ReCiPe 2016 Midpoint (H).developed_by: RIVM, Radboud University, Leiden University, PRé
ReCiPe 2016 Midpoint (H).description: Comprehensive global impact assessment method with 18 midpoint indicators. The Hierarchist perspective uses consensus model parameters with a 100-year timeframe.
pros: Global applicability with good regional adaptation
Includes both environmental and resource depletion categories
cons: Complex with many indicators to interpret
Some characterization factors still have high uncertainty
Requires careful interpretation of toxicity categories
use_cases: Product comparisons requiring full impact spectrum
Studies requiring both midpoint and endpoint perspectives

ILCD 2011 Midpoint.description: Official European Commission method for LCA. Designed specifically for European environmental policies and product regulations.
pros: Official EU method - required for EU Ecolabel and GPP
cons: Less suitable for non-European contexts
Not as frequently updated as ReCiPe
Smaller user community outside Europe
use_cases: Studies focusing on European supply chains

TRACI 2.1.full_name: Tool for the Reduction and Assessment of Chemical and other environmental Impacts
TRACI 2.1.description: US EPA's official LCIA method with characterization factors specifically developed for US environmental conditions and regulations.
pros: Characterization factors calibrated for US conditions
Excellent for US air quality impacts (smog, particulates)
Strong focus on human health impacts
cons: Limited to US environmental conditions
Fewer impact categories than ReCiPe
Not suitable for global studies
Less developed resource depletion categories
use_cases: Studies focusing on US air quality
US federal procurement and infrastructure projects

EF 3.0.description: EU's official method for environmental footprinting of products and organizations. Designed for supply chain environmental assessment and eco-design.
pros: Official EU method for product footprinting
Excellent for supply chain and product comparisons
cons: Primarily designed for European products
Complex methodology with strict rules
Requires specific data quality requirements
Less flexible than other methods
use_cases: Agricultural and food products (especially with Agribalyse)

CML-IA.description: One of the oldest and most established LCIA methods. Problem-oriented approach with well-validated characterization factors.
pros: Long history of validation and use
cons: Not updated as frequently as newer methods
Fewer impact categories than modern methods
Some characterization factors are dated
Less comprehensive than ReCiPe or ILCD
use_cases: Validation and comparison with previous LCA studies

ReCiPe 2016 Endpoint (H).developed_by: RIVM, Radboud University, Leiden University, PRé
ReCiPe 2016 Endpoint (H).description: Damage-oriented version of ReCiPe. Aggregates midpoint indicators into three damage categories (human health, ecosystem quality, resources) for easier communication.
pros: Aggregated results show overall environmental profile
Links to societal concerns (health, nature, resources)
cons: Higher uncertainty due to additional modeling steps
Loss of detailed information from midpoint level
More controversial due to value choices in aggregation
Less suitable for detailed environmental analysis
use_cases: Studies where simplified metrics are needed

elcd.reasoning: ELCD is a European database, so European methods (ILCD, EF 3.0) are most appropriate. ReCiPe works well as a global comprehensive alternative.

ecoinvent.reasoning: Ecoinvent is global and comprehensive, matching well with ReCiPe. European-focused studies can use ILCD or EF 3.0.

agribalyse.reasoning: Agribalyse is designed for use with EF 3.0 for food products. ReCiPe and ILCD are good alternatives for comprehensive assessment.

uslci.reasoning: USLCI is a US database, so TRACI (US EPA method) is most appropriate. ReCiPe works as a global comprehensive alternative.

lca_commons.reasoning: LCA Commons is US federal data, so TRACI is the preferred US EPA method. ReCiPe for comprehensive global perspective.

bioenergiedat.reasoning: German/European bioenergy data pairs well with ILCD. ReCiPe for comprehensive assessment.

needs.reasoning: European energy data works best with ILCD. ReCiPe for broader environmental coverage.

default_method.name: ReCiPe 2016 Midpoint (H)
default_method.reasoning: Most comprehensive and widely accepted global method. Good default when specific context is unknown.
